snippet: With a shortage of lethal drugs and recent executions that appear to have gone awry, the Supreme Court will soon consider whether inmates are entitled to know how the government means to kill them.
abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column examines current turmoil of American capital justice system, citing shortages of lethal drugs that have led states to use secret and suspect chemicals to execute condemned inmates; holds that recent dissent from three Supreme Court justices suggests court will soon move to resolve crucial threshold question of whether death row inmates are entitled to know how the the government means to kill them.
lead_paragraph: With a shortage of lethal drugs and recent executions that appear to have gone awry, the Supreme Court will soon consider whether inmates are entitled to know how the government means to kill them.

headline.print_headline: Deciding if Inmates Get to Know How They’ll Be Executed
headline.main: Deciding if Inmates Get to Know How They’ll Be Executed
